channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: McDonald’s has kept Europeans hooked despite its American appeal with its ever-changing menu of local foods and viral TikTok moments
item.description: Given its place in U.S. culture, McDonald’s European success might surprise some. But it's a product of the giant's deliberately curated local menus.

item.title: Rare Israeli airstrike in Beirut kills Hezbollah commander and more than a dozen others
item.description: Israel launched a rare airstrike that killed a senior Hezbollah military official in a densely populated southern Beirut neighborhood on Friday. It wa...

item.title: Ohtani clinched 50/50 while making $2 million. Here’s what he was really worth.
20% of French teens have never tasted alcohol—now wineries are making fuel for cars instead of boozy nights out
item.description: The decline in wine consumption in France since the 1970s is causing vineyards to search for different ways to use the surplus.

item.title: SEC says Elon Musk should be sanctioned if he keeps dodging Twitter depositions
item.description: The SEC asked a federal judge to sanction Elon Musk if he continues to delay a deposition regarding his 2022 Twitter buyout.

item.title: Why tech giants are turning to nuclear disaster sites to power AI data centers
London’s most expensive homes are having a hard time finding new owners
item.description: There were 22% fewer sales above £10 million ($13.2 million) in the 12 months to July, compared with the same time period from 2022–23.

item.title: Big returns before Fed rate cut doesn't mean stocks can't keep rising, history shows
item.description: "Concerns that equities have 'front-run' the Fed are ill founded, in our view," Bank of America strategist Savita Subramanian said.

item.title: Intel’s stock seals strong week. But would a Qualcomm merger make sense?
Qualcomm reportedly approached Intel for what would be the biggest chip deal ever
item.description: Intel, once the world’s largest chipmaker, has been struggling with flagging sales and mounting losses — exacerbated by the loss of its technological ...

item.title: The big post-Fed rally could get tested in week ahead: 'A lot holds in the balance'
item.description: The next several trading sessions could determine whether the big post-Fed rally can continue, especially as investors brace for a seasonally weak Oct...

item.title: Fed’s Bowman fears bigger rate cut sends ‘premature victory’ message to markets
New Boeing CEO shakes up leadership, announces first departure
item.description: Steve Parker, the defense unit’s chief operating officer, will take the helm at the struggling business on an interim basis until a replacement is fou...

item.title: Qualcomm recently approached Intel about a possible takeover
item.description: If Qualcomm were to acquire Intel, it would be one of the largest technology deals on record, but would first invite hefty regulatory scrutiny.

item.title: Dow rises to record high as stocks book weekly gains after Fed rate cut
